Articles.Content:
Thanks for the info, alas that's too technical for me. I can build engines out of rocket parts but I don't understand programming languages.

I have opened Blender with your .mu importer ... now I just need to figure out why I can't see the model.

Apparently it has something to do with the model itself, since a different, non-procedural model is visible.

Edit: I won't use Blender again. Ridiculous program. Trying with Unity.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T11:22:16Z" title="08/02/2015 11:22  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Azimech**

**Azimech**: Oh, darn. I forgot. My importer doesn't support skinned meshes yet. Unfortunately, I'm busy fighting with EL's recycler code so fixing that or doing up a suitable script for you will have to wait.

Thank you for your time :-) Maybe instead of a script someone who's proficient in these things can adapt PWing2, add the texture and add it as an extra in the mod?

I think A LOT of people would be eternally thankful - FAR compatible cockpits and fuselages with real windows, made by the users themselves.

Here's an example of struts giving the idea of a cockpit frame & windows. Imagine soft bronze tinted glass :-)

![we1Lrby.png](http://i.imgur.com/we1Lrby.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T12:05:24Z" title="08/02/2015 12:05  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Azimech**
When I attach a wing, it won't let me change its shape, and I cannot remove it.

Finally.

I'm not entirely gone so PM me if you run across something that makes even less sense than usual or just want some help.

> 
> When I attach a wing, it won't let me change its shape, and I cannot remove it.

Same issue.

Reinstalled twice.

> 
> When I attach a wing, it won't let me change its shape, and I cannot remove it.

> 
> Same issue.
> Reinstalled twice.

Can't do anything without atleast a log...

So, I'm having the same problem a couple of other people have reported about placing wings and then being unable to change their shape or remove them.

Here's my output log:

[https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0IvQ0TbDcGORGFYTFNSZ3Fla0k](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0IvQ0TbDcGORGFYTFNSZ3Fla0k)

Any clue as to what went wrong? I really love this mod (the stock wings are frankly feeble when trying to build heavy aircraft), so I'd really like to be able to use this mod!

If you need any more help, just ask ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'm having an issue while using procedural wings with far. The aircraft all fly crooked in level flight, all banked a few degrees to the left. When I turn on aerodynamic forces, there's a distinct and strong diagonal lift force from the root of the left wing only. It angles up and to the right of the aircraft at a 45 degree angle. Upwards lift on both wings is as it should be. This is a fairly fresh install of kerbal with rss, rp-0, far, etc and this only happens with procedural wings. There aren't any hidden surfaces causing this lift component as it happens even with a very basic, fresh design and few parts. Help is appreciated!
I'm wondering, why use this when there is B9 procedural wings? What is so good about each?
**legoclone09**: one good reason is older designs that otherwise still work well.
also I've ran into Less issue with these than i have th e B-9 ones.

> 
> I'm having an issue while using procedural wings with far. The aircraft all fly crooked in level flight, all banked a few degrees to the left. When I turn on aerodynamic forces, there's a distinct and strong diagonal lift force from the root of the left wing only. It angles up and to the right of the aircraft at a 45 degree angle. Upwards lift on both wings is as it should be. This is a fairly fresh install of kerbal with rss, rp-0, far, etc and this only happens with procedural wings. There aren't any hidden surfaces causing this lift component as it happens even with a very basic, fresh design and few parts. Help is appreciated!

It would appear these have developed fat mirrored wing syndrome when used with FAR. ferram4 has fixed this before, so I guess w/e he changed in the latest version didn't only affect the B9 PWings

> 
> I'm wondering, why use this when there is B9 procedural wings? What is so good about each?

PWings:

- Unrestricted dimensions (whether that is a good or bad thing I don't really want to weigh in on.)
- Simplicity

 B9 PWings

- Appearance customisation
- Granular shape customisation
- Repeatability
- Fueled
Thanks, I might see how this looks on some of my planes.

> 
> [\*]Unrestricted dimensions (whether that is a good or bad thing I don't really want to weigh in on.)

That's a VERY good thing!

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/or9lj)

305 Meters!

Welcome to one month later...

As already stated, the wings don't work, and i want them to work so i can do stuff like

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gultYGFGqBY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
, so what can i do to fix this?
These wing don't seem to produce as much lift as they should, will that ever be updated

v0.10.1

- Recompiled for 1.0.5
- Tweaked the FAR patches so CKAN's inadequacy doesn't leave people unable to fly
Would procedural radiators be possible, with a config hack or otherwise?
I've always been stumped between the difference of this vs B9 Procedural Parts. Can someone give me a rundown of how different it is and why the case for each?

> 
> 
> 26 minutes ago, ghimb2000 said:
> 
> 
> I've always been stumped between the difference of this vs B9 Procedural Parts. Can someone give me a rundown of how different it is and why the case for each?
> 

[Right on this very page.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/117236-105-procedural-dynamics-procedural-wing-v0101-12-nov/&do=findComment&comment=2191512)

Hi there

Thank you for the awesome mod, I have been using it since 0.90 

I was wondering if it would be possible to add a radiator module that would react accordingly to the size of the wing. I have been messing around with MM a lot, but this is above my understanding as i dont have any clue of how a dll is built. 

So, there is probably a bunch of equations in the dll that determine the weight of the wing depending on its general shape and size, is it possible to add a line there and output maybe two new arbitrary variable, like fuel volume and radiator capacity, that could be used by a tank or radiator module if it needs to? 

I'm quite unsure if it's possible thought, MM is patching everything at loading, and it seems like Pwing dll is outputing the weight value in the VAB. So it means that the dll would need to output a radiator capacity value in the VAB as well, could it be as simple as copying the line, multiplying by a ratio, and giving the value a name. Or do we have to code a whole bunch of stuff to make sure the value get outputed in the right field ? 

Anyways, It would be great to have such an option, as much as a compatibility with interstellar fuel switch (wich would probably require the same kind of work )
What about 1.0.5 compatibility? We still need that.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Kebab Kerman said:
> 
> 
> What about 1.0.5 compatibility? We still need that.
> 

[Few posts above](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/117236-105-procedural-dynamics-procedural-wing-v0101-12-nov/&do=findComment&comment=2272388) on this page.

Hi Crzyrndm and thanks for updating my favorite wings mod, and DYI for making it.

I have made a video of the mod within my KSP Mod Spotlight series

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xhaAi3rnjVs?feature=oembed" width="459"></iframe>

If you like it feel free to use it on your forum page :-). Keep up the great work
